question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the matrix that corresponds to projecting onto the $y$-axis.
inference:
The matrix that corresponds to projecting onto the $y$-axis is:

$$\begin{bmatrix}0&0\\\0&1\end{bmatrix}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$$\begin{bmatrix}0&0\\\0&1\end{bmatrix}$$} I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
The transformation that projects onto the $y$-axis takes $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}$ to $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix},$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}$ to $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix},$ so the matrix is
\[\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}}.\]

question:
The matrix that corresponds to projecting onto the $y$-axis is:

$$\begin{bmatrix}0&0\\\0&1\end{bmatrix}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$$\begin{bmatrix}0&0\\\0&1\end{bmatrix}$$} I hope it is correct.
There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
ground_truth:
The transformation that projects onto the $y$-axis takes $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}$ to $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix},$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}$ to $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix},$ so the matrix is
\[\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
